com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.locationlayer

Class LocationLayerPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.locationlayer.LocationLayerPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleObserver, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.maps.MapView.OnMapChangedListener, com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.location.LocationEngineListener

    public class LocationLayerPlugin
extends Object
implements com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.location.LocationEngineListener, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.maps.MapView.OnMapChangedListener, android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleObserver
    The Location layer plugin provides location awareness to your mobile application. Enabling this plugin provides a contextual experience to your users by showing an icon representing the users current location. A few different modes are offered to provide the right context to your users at the correct time. LocationLayerMode.TRACKING simply shows the users location on the map represented as a dot. LocationLayerMode.COMPASS mode allows you to display an arrow icon (by default) that points in the direction the device is pointing in. LocationLayerMode.NAVIGATION can be used in conjunction with our Navigation SDK to display a larger icon we call the user puck. Lastly, LocationLayerMode.NONE can be used to disable the Location Layer but keep the instance around till the activity is destroyed.

    Using this plugin requires you to request permission beforehand manually or using PermissionsManager. Either ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permissions can be requested and this plugin work as expected.

    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • setLocationLayerEnabled

        public void setLocationLayerEnabled(int locationLayerMode)
        After creating an instance of this plugin, you can use this API to enable the location mode of your choice. These modes can be found in the LocationLayerMode class and the parameter only accepts one of those modes. Note that before enabling the My Location layer, you will need to ensure that you have the requested the required user location permissions.

        • LocationLayerMode.TRACKING: Display the user location on the map as a small dot
        • LocationLayerMode.COMPASS: Display the user location and current heading/bearing
        • LocationLayerMode.NAVIGATION: Display the user location on the map using a navigation icon
        • LocationLayerMode.NONE: Disable user location showing on the map
        Parameters:
        locationLayerMode - one of the modes found in LocationLayerMode
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getLocationLayerMode

        public int getLocationLayerMode()
        Returns the current location mode being used with this plugin.
        Returns:
        on of the LocationLayerMode values
        Since:
        0.1.0

        public void forceLocationUpdate(@Nullable

      • setLocationEngine

        public void setLocationEngine(@Nullable
                              com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.location.LocationEngine locationEngine)
        The LocationEngine the plugin will use to update it's position. If null is passed in, all updates will occur through the forceLocationUpdate(Location) method.
        Parameters:
        locationEngine - a LocationEngine this plugin should use to handle updates
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • isLinearAnimation

        public boolean isLinearAnimation()
        Check whether the location update animator is using a linear or an accelerate/decelerate interpolator. When the navigation mode is being used, the animator automatically become linear.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the location update animator is set to linear, otherwise false
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setLinearAnimation

        public void setLinearAnimation(boolean linearAnimation)
        Set whether the location update animator is using linear (true) or an accelerate/decelerate (false) interpolator. When the navigation mode is being used, the animator automatically become linear.
        Parameters:
        linearAnimation - boolean true if you'd like to set the location update animator to linear, otherwise false
        Since:
        0.1.0
